item.title: Recursive Call: The DAO on the Brink of Death and Ethereum To Be Hardforked
item.description:
Recursive Call: The DAO on the Brink of Death and Ethereum To Be Hardforked

Ethereum Foundation headed by Vitalik Buterin opted to save the DAO funds for investors. However, the latter will only have an option of withdrawing funds. The DAO, as it may seem, is no more.

item.title: What is blockchain?
item.description:
What is blockchain?

Answer (1 of 2): Blockchain is a decentralized network that does not require any intermediate system for the exchange of services. It keeps a shared record of all the transactions distributed over a vast network of users. A blockchain is comprised of a series of data blocks wherein each block sto...

item.title: Could the U.S. ban bitcoin?
item.description:
Could the U.S. ban bitcoin?

Answer (1 of 4): Probably-they don't have an enormous lobby such as the NRA. Dark money doesn't kill people, special interests do. The history of China's ambivalent attitude toward BTC is instructive: > On 5th December 2013, the People's Bank of China and five other related government ministri...

item.title: Canada's Central Bank Is Working on a Blockchain-Based Digital Dollar
item.description:
Canada's Central Bank Is Working on a Blockchain-Based Digital Dollar

In a revelation on Wednesday, the Bank of Canada - Canada's central bank - said that it is developing a digital currency called CAD-Coin, in collaboration with Canadian banks and New York-based blockchain startup R3. In a private presentation during the payments industry conference Payments Panorama in Calgary, the Bank of Canada revealed it is developing a digital equivalent of the Canadian dollar called CAD-Coin.

item.title: Emotional Rollercoaster - Create, Discover and Share GIFs on Gfycat
Should Ethereum Hardfork or Allow Hackers to Run with $50 Million?
item.description:
Should Ethereum Hardfork or Allow Hackers to Run with $50 Million?

The Ethereum community has a monumental and historical decision to make after the shocking theft of $50 million held on the DAO smart contract. The proposed solutions by the Ethereum's developer community to the on-going hack is a fork, according to a Critical Update by Vitalik Buterin.

item.title: Will Ethereum Hard Fork? - CoinDesk
item.description:
Will Ethereum Hard Fork? - CoinDesk

Key stakeholders behind the alternative blockchain platform ethereum are debating changes to the platform's code after millions of dollars in ether were diverted from a major project by an alleged attacker.

item.title: Number of Cyber Threats Increased During 2015
item.description:
Number of Cyber Threats Increased During 2015

Ransomware attacks are still a top concern for IT services all over the world. But a new trend is emerging in the form of Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition. Hackers continue to come up with new ways to make lives of enterprises miserable.

item.title: Bitcoin Price
item.description:
Bitcoin Price

The bitcoin price is very volatile and has seen some large fluctuations since its inception in 2011 when you could buy one bitcoin for just a few cents. Since then the bitcoin price has increased each year until it reached its high of $1200 per bitcoin in late 2013.

item.title: How do you apply "-zapwallettxes" on Windows?
item.description:
How do you apply "-zapwallettxes" on Windows?

zapwallettxes removes all wallet transactions that are not in the blockchain. It can remove "stuck" transactions, although you don't need this feature in normal operations mode. Solution A) On Windows, you need to start the command line prompt (cmd.exe), go to your window search and enter "cmd" and start cmd.exe.
